title: 1983 Cricket World Cup
summary: The 1983 Cricket World Cup (officially the Prudential Cup '83) was the 3rd edition of the Cricket World Cup tournament. It was held from 9 June to 25 June 1983 in England and Wales and was won by India.

value.label: England is a country that is part of the United Kingdom. It shares land borders with Wales to the west and Scotland to the north-northwest.
No man of the series awarded in 1983, India

image.altText: Picture of No man of the series awarded in 1983

value.label: The India national cricket team is also known as Team India and Men in Blue. India is ranked first in Tests, second in ODIs and second in T20Is by the ICC. Virat Kohli is the current captain of the team, while the head coach is Ravi Shastri.

image.altText: Picture of India national cricket team

value.label: The West Indies cricket team, traditionally known as the Windies, is a multi-national cricket team representing the Anglophone Caribbean region and administered by Cricket West Indies. The players on this composite team are selected from a chain of fifteen Caribbean territories

image.altText: Picture of India national cricket team
